channel.title: PI Changing Xp Rates [Skills]
channel.description:
For Some People Who can't Change them skills in Config.java For some Reason. Then You Should Go In src\server\model\players\skills. Open Skill In Which One You would like to change XP. And Then You Need To Look For something like this- This is for Mining: [code] public final int[][] Rock_Settings = { { 2091, 1, 18, 3, 436 }, // Copper { 2095, 1, 180 , 3, 438 }, // Tin { 2093, 15, 350, 7, 440 }, // Iron { 2097, 30, 500, 38, 453 }, // Coal { 2103, 55, 800, 155, 447 }, // Mithril { 2105, 70, 950, 315, 449 }, // Addy { 2107, 85, 1250, 970, 451 }, // Rune { 2090, 1, 180, 3, 436 }, // Copper { 2094, 1, 180, 3, 438 }, // Tin { 2092, 15, 350, 7, 440 }, // Iron { 2096, 30, 500, 38, 453 }, // Coal { 2102, 55, 800, 155, 447 }, // Mithril { 2104, 70, 950, 315, 449 }, // Addy { 14859, 85, 1250, 970, 451 }, // Rune { 2100, 20, 400, 78, 442 }, // Silver { 2101, 20, 400, 78, 442 }, // Silver { 2098, 40, 650, 78, 444 }, // Gold { 2099, 40, 650, 78, 444 } // Gold };[/code] { 2095, 1, 180 , 3, 438 }, // Tin Red Text is what you need to change. ( Decrease for smaller xp and increase for bigger)
Woodcutting is Like this: [code] public final int[][] Tree_Settings = { { 1276, 1342, 1,250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree { 1278, 1342, 1,250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree { 1286, 1342, 1, 250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Dead Tree { 1281, 1356, 15, 380, 1521, 11, 20 }, // Oak { 1308, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 5552, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 1307, 1343, 45, 1000, 1517, 48, 8 }, // Maple { 1309, 7402, 60, 1750, 1515, 79, 5 }, // Yew { 1306, 7401, 75, 2500, 1513, 150, 3 }, // Magic { 5551, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 5553, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 } // Willow };[/code] { 1276, 1342, 1, 250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree Red is what you need to change.
There is almost no Difference In this.
[size=18pt]And Before Peoples Start to hate i just made this because I have seen many peoples looking for this But No one helped Them, They Was Only saying its in config.java But for many people it's not working.[/size]

item.title: PI Changing Xp Rates [Skills]
item.dc:creator: @ljoxaa ljoxaa
item.description:
@ljoxaa wrote:

For Some People Who can’t Change them skills in Config.java For some Reason. Then You Should Go In src\server\model\players\skills. Open Skill In Which One You would like to change XP. And Then You Need To Look For something like this-
This is for Mining:

public final int[][] Rock_Settings = { { 2091, 1, 18, 3, 436 }, // Copper { 2095, 1, 180 , 3, 438 }, // Tin { 2093, 15, 350, 7, 440 }, // Iron { 2097, 30, 500, 38, 453 }, // Coal { 2103, 55, 800, 155, 447 }, // Mithril { 2105, 70, 950, 315, 449 }, // Addy { 2107, 85, 1250, 970, 451 }, // Rune { 2090, 1, 180, 3, 436 }, // Copper { 2094, 1, 180, 3, 438 }, // Tin { 2092, 15, 350, 7, 440 }, // Iron { 2096, 30, 500, 38, 453 }, // Coal { 2102, 55, 800, 155, 447 }, // Mithril { 2104, 70, 950, 315, 449 }, // Addy { 14859, 85, 1250, 970, 451 }, // Rune { 2100, 20, 400, 78, 442 }, // Silver { 2101, 20, 400, 78, 442 }, // Silver { 2098, 40, 650, 78, 444 }, // Gold { 2099, 40, 650, 78, 444 } // Gold };
{ 2095, 1, 180 , 3, 438 }, // Tin
Red Text is what you need to change. ( Decrease for smaller xp and increase for bigger)

Woodcutting is Like this:

public final int[][] Tree_Settings = { { 1276, 1342, 1,250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree { 1278, 1342, 1,250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree { 1286, 1342, 1, 250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Dead Tree { 1281, 1356, 15, 380, 1521, 11, 20 }, // Oak { 1308, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 5552, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 1307, 1343, 45, 1000, 1517, 48, 8 }, // Maple { 1309, 7402, 60, 1750, 1515, 79, 5 }, // Yew { 1306, 7401, 75, 2500, 1513, 150, 3 }, // Magic { 5551, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 }, // Willow { 5553, 7399, 30, 680, 1519, 11, 8 } // Willow };
{ 1276, 1342, 1, 250, 1511, 45, 100 }, // Tree
Red is what you need to change.

There is almost no Difference In this.

[size=18pt]And Before Peoples Start to hate i just made this because I have seen many peoples looking for this But No one helped Them, They Was Only saying its in config.java But for many people it’s not working.[/size]

Read full topic
